alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 23 at 4:12PM MST until August 23 at 5:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE ANTELOPE CREEK BASIN REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM MST/645 PM MDT/ THIS AFTERNOON FOR COCONINO COUNTY... At 408 PM MST /508 PM MDT/, Only light showers remain over Antelope Creek basin. Earlier 0.75 to 1.75 inches rainfall was estimated by radar over a 45 minute period 2 miles south of Canyon X. This push of water has likely not cleared Upper and Lower Antelope Canyon. Avoid slot canyons in this area. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Antelope Creek basin. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Antelope Creek basin. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Page, Porcupine Canyon, Upper Antelope Canyon, Wind Pebble Canyon, Rattlesnake Canyon, Mountain Sheep Canyon, Ramshead Canyon, Owl Canyon, Cardiac Canyon, Antelope Canyon Near Sr 98, Lower Antelope Canyon, Canyon X, Page Airport, Trapeze Cove, Antelope Creek Basin, Glen Canyon National Recreation Area, Lake Powell and Navajo Reservation. This includes the following slot canyons... Upper Antelope Canyon, Lower Antelope Canyon, Canyon X, Cardiac Canyon, Owl Canyon, Rattlesnake Canyon, Mountain Sheep Canyon, Ramshead Canyon, Wind Pebble Canyon and Porcupine Canyon. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Antelope Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Get out of Antelope Canyon and other area slot canyons immediately! Deadly flash flooding is imminent or occurring!
